t: Luke 23
And*p the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.
And*p they began to accuse him, saying, We found this fellow perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.
And*p Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou*r sayest*r it.*r
Then*p said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people, I find no fault in this man.
And*p they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Judaea, beginning from Galilee to this place.
When*p Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.
And*p as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.
And*p when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long season, because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.
Then*p he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.
And*p the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.
And*p Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mocked him, and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.
And*p the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.
And*p Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

Said*p unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined him before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:
No,*p nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.
I*p will therefore chastise him, and release him.
(For*p of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)
And*p they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas:
(Who*p for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)
Pilate*p therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.
But*p they cried, saying, Crucify him, crucify him.
And*p he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let him go.
And*p they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.
And*p Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.
And*p he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
And*p as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.
And*p there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.
But*p Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters*r of*r Jerusalem,*r weep*r not*r for*r me,*r but*r weep*r for*r yourselves,*r and*r for*r your*r children.*r

For,*rp behold,*r the*r days*r are*r coming,*r in*r the*r which*r they*r shall*r say,*r Blessed*r are*r the*r barren,*r and*r the*r wombs*r that*r never*r bare,*r and*r the*r paps*r which*r never*r gave*r suck.*r
Then*rp shall*r they*r begin*r to*r say*r to*r the*r mountains,*r Fall*r on*r us;*r and*r to*r the*r hills,*r Cover*r us.*r
For*rp if*r they*r do*r these*r things*r in*r a*r green*r tree,*r what*r shall*r be*r done*r in*r the*r dry?*r
And*p there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.
And*p when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.
Then*p said Jesus, Father,*r forgive*r them;*r for*r they*r know*r not*r what*r they*r do.*r And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.
And*p the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them derided him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.
And*p the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,
And*p saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.
And*p a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
And*p one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.
But*p the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?
And*p we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.
And*p he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.
And*p Jesus said unto him, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r To*r day*r shalt*r thou*r be*r with*r me*r in*r paradise.*r
And*p it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
And*p the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.
And*p when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father,*r into*r thy*r hands*r I*r commend*r my*r spirit:*r and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.
Now*p when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.
And*p all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.
And*p all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.
And,*p behold, there was a man named Joseph, a counsellor; and he was a good man, and a just:
(The*p same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) he was of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.
This*p man went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.
And*p he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.
And*p that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.
And*p the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.
And*p they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.
